item.title: 富士胶片曾经为销售相机而苦苦挣扎。现在，它已经跟不上需求了
item.description: 多年来，日本富士胶片公司（Fujifilm）放弃了传统的相机业务，转而专注于医疗保健领域。但在很大程度上，由于 TikTok 的热捧，其复古主题的 X100 数码相机如今大获成功，为公司带来了丰厚的利润。【原文：For years, Japan's Fujifilm pivoted away from its legacy camera business to focus on healthcare. But thanks in large part to the TikTok crowd, its retro-themed X100 digital cameras are a now a roaring success, boosting its bottom line.】

item.title: 华为 "和谐号 "旨在结束中国对 Windows 和安卓系统的依赖
item.description: 在一间狭小的房间里，无人机、双足机器人、超市收银台和其他设备展示了中国软件未来的愿景--由中国软件冠军华为开发的操作系统将取代 Windows 和 Android。【原文：Packed into a small room, a drone, bipedal robot, supermarket checkout and other devices showcase a vision of China's software future - one where an operating system developed by national champion Huawei has replaced Windows and Android.】

item.title: 澳大利亚批准澳新银行斥资 33 亿美元收购新科银行
item.description: 澳大利亚周五批准澳新银行集团（ANZ Group）以 49 亿澳元（32.6 亿美元）收购新科银行（Suncorp）的银行业务，经过金融监管机构和财政部近两年的审查，该交易得以继续进行。【原文：Australia on Friday gave the go-ahead for ANZ Group's A$4.9 billion ($3.26 billion) buyout of Suncorp's banking business, clearing the deal to proceed after almost two years of scrutiny by financial regulators and treasury.】

item.title: 工会称波音公司的困境不会削弱工人罢工的意愿
item.description: 波音公司的工会主席周四告诉路透社记者，波音公司最近在一月份的一次空中面板爆炸事故后面临的财务和生产挑战不会改变其工人为在谈判中取得进展而举行罢工的意愿。【原文：Boeing's recent financial and production challenges following a January mid-air panel blow out will not change their workers' readiness to strike to make gains in bargaining, their union local president told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 早间新闻东京通货膨胀，上半场门得分
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，微软告诉客户俄罗斯组织入侵了电子邮件
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引微软公司发言人的话报道，微软公司正在通知其部分客户，一个由俄罗斯国家支持的黑客组织侵入了其内部系统，并访问了他们的电子邮件。【原文：Microsoft Corp is informing some of its customers that a Russian state-sponsored hacking group breached its internal systems and accessed their emails, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing a company spokesperson.】

item.title: 沙特开发商 Dar Global 计划在美国投资 3 亿美元进行扩张
item.description: 沙特房地产开发商 Dar Global 计划未来几个月在纽约、迈阿密和洛杉矶投资 3 亿美元，寻找合作伙伴在美国开发豪华住宅。【原文：Saudi property developer Dar Global plans to invest $300 million in New York, Miami and Los Angeles in the coming months as it seeks partners to develop luxury homes the United States.】

item.title: Illumina 将在第二季度计提 14.7 亿美元与 Grail 相关的商誉减值费用
item.description: Illumina 公司周四表示，将在第二季度计提 14.7 亿美元的商誉减值费用，这笔费用与最近分拆的 Grail Inc .【原文：Illumina said on Thursday it will take a goodwill impairment charge of $1.47 billion in the second quarter related to the recently spun-off Grail Inc .】

item.title: 标普全球宣布内部人士张曼玉出任首席执行官
item.description: 金融信息公司 S&P Global 周四宣布，任命内部人士 Martina Cheung 为首席执行官，11 月 1 日起生效。【原文：Financial information company S&P Global announced on Thursday that it has appointed insider Martina Cheung as CEO effective on Nov. 1.】

item.title: 十大银行就美国利率掉期操纵诉讼达成和解
item.description: 包括美国银行、高盛和摩根大通在内的十家大型银行将支付 4600 万美元，以了结一项旷日持久的反垄断诉讼，该诉讼指控这些银行合谋操纵目前价值 465.9 万亿美元的利率掉期市场。【原文：Ten large banks including Bank of America , Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase will pay $46 million to settle a long-running antitrust lawsuit accusing them of conspiring to rig the now $465.9 trillion market for interest rate swaps.】

item.title: 诺基亚将以 23 亿美元收购英飞朗
item.description: 诺基亚和英飞朗两家公司周四表示，诺基亚将收购英飞朗公司，交易价格为每股 6.65 美元，企业价值 23 亿美元。【原文：Nokia will acquire Infinera Corp in a deal valuing it at $6.65 per share, or an enterprise value of $2.3 billion, the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: 加拿大沃尔玛将尼古拉氢燃料电池电动半挂卡车纳入车队
item.description: 尼古拉表示，它已向加拿大沃尔玛公司交付了一辆氢燃料电池电动半挂卡车，使其成为该国首家将氢燃料电池电动半挂卡车纳入其车队的大型零售商。【原文：Nikola said it has delivered a hydrogen fuel cell powered electric semi-truck to Walmart Canada , making it the first major retailer in the country to add it to its fleet.】

item.title: 耐克运动鞋需求不振，季度收入不及预期
item.description: 耐克公司周四公布的第四季度营收不及市场预期，原因是这家运动服装巨头被新品牌甩在了后面。【原文：Nike missed market expectations for fourth-quarter revenue on Thursday, as the sportswear giant lost ground to newer brands.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称，尽管美国经济增长强劲，但仍需解决债务问题
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）周四呼吁美国提高税收以遏制债务水平的上升，同时对这个世界最大经济体 "强劲、充满活力 "的增长以及在控制通货膨胀方面取得的进展表示赞赏。【原文：The International Monetary Fund on Thursday called on the U.S. to raise taxes to curb rising debt levels while applauding "robust, dynamic" growth in the world's largest economy and progress towards bringing inflation under control.】

item.title: 巴西 5 月份创造的正式工作岗位少于预期
item.description: 巴西劳工部周四公布的数据显示，巴西经济在 5 月份净创造了 131811 个正式工作岗位，低于路透社对经济学家进行的一项调查所预测的 20 万个。【原文：Brazil's economy created a net 131,811 formal jobs in May, Labor Ministry data released on Thursday showed, falling short of the 200,000 forecast in a Reuters poll of economists.】

item.title: 美国最高法院对普渡大学的裁决使大规模侵权行为更难在破产中解决
item.description: 美国最高法院的一项裁决破坏了奥施康定（OxyContin）生产商普渡制药公司（Purdue Pharma）的破产保护和解协议，并大幅缩减了法院对未申请破产的实体进行法律索赔的能力，破产可能会成为一种不那么有吸引力的解决庞大诉讼的方式。【原文：Bankruptcy may become a less attractive way to resolve sprawling lawsuits after a U.S. Supreme Court ruling scuttled OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma's Chapter 11 settlement and sharply scaled back a court's ability to wipe away legal claims against entities that have not filed for bankruptcy themselves.】

item.title: 中国工厂六月生产活动继续下滑：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社周四的一项民意调查显示，6月份中国制造业活动可能出现第二个月的萎缩，在近期一系列指标显示中国经济正努力恢复元气之后，要求采取新刺激措施的呼声依然不绝于耳。【原文：China's manufacturing activity likely contracted for a second month in June, a Reuters poll showed on Thursday, keeping alive calls for fresh stimulus after a string of recent indicators showed the economy struggling to get back on its feet.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼：在通胀退潮更加明朗之前不准备降息
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）周四重申，在通胀压力依然高企的情况下，她仍不准备支持央行降息。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman reiterated on Thursday that she is still not ready to support a central bank rate cut with inflation pressures still elevated.】

item.title: 消息人士称，阿美石油公司即将同意获得雷诺和吉利热力发动机合资公司 10% 的股份
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士称，沙特阿美公司将获得雷诺与中国吉利成立的热力发动机合资企业 Horse Powertrain 10% 的股份，从而在电动汽车销售放缓的情况下，加强为传统汽车制造商供货的业务。【原文：Saudi Aramco is set to take a 10% stake in a thermal engine joint venture between Renault and China's Geely called Horse Powertrain, said two sources familiar with the matter, beefing up a business supplying legacy automakers as electric-vehicle sales slow.】

item.title: 据 PA 报道，塔塔钢铁公司将提前停止英国工厂的运营
item.description: 据 PA Media 周四报道，由于计划中的罢工，塔塔钢铁公司将采取措施在 7 月 7 日之前停止其位于威尔士塔尔伯特港的工厂的运营，比原计划提前。【原文：Tata Steel will take steps to cease operations at its plant in Port Talbot, Wales, by July 7, earlier than planned, because of a scheduled strike, PA Media reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 特斯拉在法庭上辩称，埃隆-马斯克因投票赢得了 560 亿美元的发薪日
item.description: 据周五公开的法庭文件显示，特斯拉声称埃隆-马斯克赢得了有关其 560 亿美元薪酬方案的法律诉讼，因为尽管法官在今年早些时候撤销了这一薪酬方案，但股东们还是投了赞成票。【原文：Tesla is claiming Elon Musk won his legal battle over his $56 billion pay package because shareholders voted for the compensation, despite a judge rescinding it earlier this year, according to court filing made public on Friday.】

item.title: 美达公司必须面对声称其偏爱外国工人而非美国公民的诉讼
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周四恢复了一名软件工程师提出的集体诉讼，该工程师声称 Meta Platforms 公司拒绝雇用他，因为该公司更愿意把工作交给工资更低的外国工人。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Thursday revived a software engineer's proposed class action claiming Meta Platforms refused to hire him because it preferred to give jobs to foreign workers who are paid lower wages.】

item.title: Webtoon 首次登陆纳斯达克，股价大涨 14
item.description: 在线漫画平台 Webtoon Entertainment 周四在纳斯达克首次上市，股价比首次公开发行价飙升 14.3%。【原文：Shares of online comics platform Webtoon Entertainment surged as much as 14.3% above their initial public offering price in their Nasdaq debut on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国最高法院对普渡制药公司做出裁决后值得关注的破产案件
item.description: 美国最高法院周四做出裁决，否决了奥施康定生产商普渡制药公司（Purdue Pharma）的破产和解方案，这可能会对美国破产法院如何处理旨在解决庞大诉讼的案件产生全面影响。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court's ruling on Thursday scuttling OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma's bankruptcy settlement could have a sweeping impact on how U.S. bankruptcy courts handle cases aimed at resolving sprawling litigation.】

item.title: 电网运营商称，得克萨斯州的电力需求将在热浪中打破 6 月和 7 月的记录
item.description: 德克萨斯州电网运营商预测，随着家庭和企业为躲避热浪而开动空调，用电量将在本周四打破 6 月份的高峰需求记录，随后将进一步攀升，并在下周打破 7 月份的记录。【原文：The Texas power-grid operator forecast electricity use will break the peak demand record for June on Thursday before rising even higher and topping the July record next week as homes and businesses crank up air conditioners to escape a heat wave.】

item.title: 美国顶级运营商称漫游用户面临连接问题
item.description: 美国主要电信服务提供商周四表示，由于一家合作网络提供商的问题，他们在海外旅行的一些用户遇到了连接问题。【原文：Major U.S. telecom service providers said on Thursday some of their users traveling overseas were having connectivity problems due to an issue at a partner network provider.】

item.title: 墨西哥就有争议的采矿特许权寻求与中国锂企业达成协议
item.description: 墨西哥总统安德烈斯-曼努埃尔-洛佩斯-奥夫拉多尔（Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador）周四表示，他的政府将寻求与中国锂矿开采商赣锋达成一项协议，同时仍将捍卫墨西哥的权利。【原文：Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Thursday that his government will seek an agreement with Chinese lithium miner Ganfeng while still defending Mexico's rights, after the firm filed an arbitration case over a disputed concession.】

item.title: 中国可能对欧盟猪肉采取的行动对巴西来说可能是把双刃剑
item.description: 分析师和业内人士说，中国可能对欧盟进口猪肉实施反倾销措施，这对欧盟来说是一个灾难性的局面，可能会使巴西出口商受益，但也会影响巴西在其他地方的竞争能力。【原文：China's potential imposition of anti-dumping measures on European Union pork imports, a disastrous scenario for the bloc, could benefit Brazil's exporters but also affect the country's ability to compete elsewhere, analysts and industry sources said.】

item.title: 马萨诸塞州最高法院允许对决的 "临时工 "投票措施继续进行
item.description: 马萨诸塞州最高法院周四为该州选民决定是否应将优步（Uber Technologies）和 Lyft 等应用程序公司的司机归类为独立承包商扫清了道路，这些司机将有权享受一些新的福利，但在法律上不属于雇员。【原文：Massachusetts's top court on Thursday cleared the way for voters in the state to decide whether drivers for app-based companies like Uber Technologies and Lyft should be classified as independent contractors who would be entitled to some new benefits but would not be legally employees.】

item.title: 美国银行经受住美联储年度压力测试，但风险上升
item.description: 根据美联储年度压力测试的结果，美国大型银行拥有足够的资本来抵御可能出现的严重经济衰退，但其部分高风险业务今年可能会受到重创。【原文：Big U.S. banks had enough capital to weather a potentially severe economic downturn but some of their risky businesses could hypothetically take a major hit this year, according to results of the Federal Reserve's annual stress test.】
